result.execSummary:
The defendant Elexcia N Sopa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber, standard release conditions

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint, incidental contact at school only.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elexcia N Sopa

records.addlTxt:
8:43 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. 
Defendant Elexcia N Sopa in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Elexcia N Sopa. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Court orders the following:
30 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 1 YEAR
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 40 Hours Community Service
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
 No contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint, incidental contact at school only
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Andy Herbers appointed counsel by Public Defender's Office

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:52 AM Defendant Elexcia N Sopa in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
